intro: Dichromanthus, commonly known as the two-colored bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink or red. Dichromanthus species often have aromatic leaves and are adapted to grow in a variety of soil types. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in coastal and sandy environments.
